summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2019 between defense attorney Jeff Pagliuca and a federal prosecutor regarding Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss scheduling a proffer meeting, accepting service of a grand jury subpoena for Maxwell, and the imminent unsealing of Jeffrey Epstein's indictment.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, corresponding with federal prosecutors to arrange a proffer meeting and accept service of a grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Copied on emails between Jeff Pagliuca and the federal prosecutor, appears to be a colleague involved in the case coordination.

persons.name: Mark
persons.context: Mentioned in passing as someone who was expected to provide an update on the status of scheduling a call.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the grand jury subpoena and potential proffer meeting discussed in the emails. Jeff Pagliuca is her attorney.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced regarding the timing of his indictment being unsealed, which affects the prosecutors' schedule.

connections.description: Pagliuca is explicitly acting as Maxwell's attorney, accepting service of a subpoena on her behalf and planning to discuss a proffer letter with her.
Simmons is consistently copied on the email correspondence, indicating she is a colleague working with Pagliuca on the Maxwell case.
The legal proceedings against Maxwell are directly connected to the case against Epstein, as indicated by the scheduling around his indictment unsealing.

events.title: Expected Unsealing of Epstein Indictment
events.description: The federal prosecutor anticipates the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein will be unsealed and become publicly available.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Call
events.description: A call was scheduled between Jeff Pagliuca and federal prosecutors to discuss a proffer agreement for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Pagliuca's Court Appearance in Aspen
events.description: Jeff Pagliuca mentions having a court appearance in Aspen, Colorado.

events.title: Initial Discussion and Subpoena Service
events.description: Jeff Pagliuca and a federal prosecutor speak, and Pagliuca accepts service of a grand jury subpoena for Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney, Jeff Pagliuca, was in communication with federal prosecutors in July 2019 to arrange a proffer meeting.
A grand jury subpoena for testimony had been issued to Ghislaine Maxwell by the Southern District of New York.
The correspondence is timed around the imminent public unsealing of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein.
The emails show the logistical coordination between defense and prosecution in the early stages of the Maxwell investigation following Epstein's arrest.
